title: Bernhard Ott 2016 Ried Rosenberg Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)
description: This wine's ripe yellow pear notes are joined by riper notions of yellow plum, with a characteristic salty, herbal tang. The concentrated, fresh palate picks up those notes and puts the yeasty soy-like savor to the fore. Salty, dry freshness rings long into the finish.

title: Bernhard Ott 2016 Ried Stein Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)
description: The sun-ripened yellow pear notes on the nose of this wine still have the faintest touch of flinty reduction. The concentrated salty, yeasty flavors on the palate bring a pithy, lip-smacking note of miso and soy. This is impressive and lasting. Drink 2018–2026.

title: Domaine Jean-Michel Gerin 2013 Champin Le Seigneur  (Côte Rôtie)
description: Swirls of char, smoke, earth and game mingle into bright tones of black cassis and plum in this alluring, savory wine. A quiet seductress rather than a powerhouse Côte-Rôtie, this soft-spoken yet deeply complex bottling should improve through 2030.

title: Donelan 2014 Cuvée Moriah Red (Sonoma County)
description: This memorable wine blends 84% Grenache from the Dry Stack Vineyard in Bennett Valley with 16% Mourvèdre from the Kopf Vineyard. It's exotic and approachable, offering a rich taste of cherry liqueur and tart pomegranate with a background of soft oak and earthy baking spice.

title: Erasmo 2012 Late Harvest Torontel (Maule Valley)
description: A burnished gold color and rich honeyed aromas open this dessert Torontel with Old World shadings. A balanced palate suggests lateharvest Pinot Gris from Alsace, while flavors of honey, caramel and toffee finish with a pecan note. Drink through 2028.

title: Esterházy 2015 Ried Föllig Blaufränkisch (Leithaberg)
description: The nose is still closed and shy, just giving off hints of cherry. The palate is also taut and tightly coiled. Fine, taut tannins are still drying and firm, the fruit is still enclosed with brisk freshness. There is a dense core of fruit that still needs to unfold. This is powerful but remains resolutely elegant. Give this time to come into its own. Drink 2022–2030.

title: Esterházy 2015 Ried Schildten Blaufränkisch (Leithaberg)
description: Beautifully aromatic and pure notions of red cherry and tart blueberry become immediately apparent on the nose. They also swish across the palate where they reverberate with alcoholic warmth and a ripe, taut and concentrated density that is countered by equally impressive freshness. The long finish pull these elements together into a potent, powerful but smooth red. Drink 2020–2028.

title: Everhart Cellars 2014 Dorado Canyon Vineyard Malbec (El Dorado)
description: Very ripe and concentrated, this full-bodied wine has powerful fruit flavors, a big impact on the palate and very firm tannins to hold it together. The color is very deep, the aromas are like ripe blackberries dusted with cinnamon and cedar, and the flavors go deep and long, lingering on the finish.

title: Foursight 2015 Charles Vineyard Zero Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is an envelope-pushing wine that's distinctive and untamed in the way that it combines earthy, savory and mineral aromas with complex, meaty and fruity flavors that have wonderful depth on the palate and length on the finish. The balance is spot-on due to firm acidity and lean tannins, supporting the tangle of unusual and enjoyable tastes. Zero in this case means no added yeast, no new oak and no fining or filtration.

title: Hermann Moser 2016 Ried Gebling Reserve Riesling (Kremstal)
description: This wine's intriguing nose offers creamy apricot and zesty green Seville orange notes. The interplay is less dramatic on the fluid, dry and fresh palate, where zestiness definitely has the upper hand. It's ripe and rounded. Long live Riesling contradictions, especially when they are so delicious and persistent.

title: Hirsch 2016 Ried Heiligenstein Riesling (Kamptal)
description: This wine's nose gives a tropical aspect of pineapple, a green hint of moss and a citrusy dash of lime. The slender, almost slight palate comes in with juicy, fluid freshness that surrounds a vein of lemon flavor. The dry finish has a cleansing quality.

title: Jean-Marc Burgaud 2016 Grands Cras  (Morgon)
description: One of three bottlings from this producer that showcases different aspects of Morgon, this wine is full, seriously structured and has the potential of great fruitiness. That will take time; for now the wine is a series of rich tannins that are very mineral in texture. Drink from 2019.

title: K Vintners 2014 Rock Garden Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Coming from The Rocks District, the aromas pop, with notes of flower, raspberry, moist earth, wet gravel, green stem, smoked meat, peat and musk. The palate shimmers with intensity but still shows a lot of restraint, displaying an assortment of fruit and savory flavors that persist on the finish.

title: Kirnbauer 2015 Das Phantom Red (Burgenland)
description: The merest hint of tar rises from the glass. The palate needs a lot of swishing to open up but allows glimpses of black cherry and white pepper, of ripeness and cinnamon spice, of precision and freshness. The tannic frame is fine but still closed and very crunchy. Allow this to mellow a little, then rejoice in the balance provided by the vivid freshness. Drink 2020–2028.

title: Lapostolle 2014 Cuvée Alexandre Viñedo Apalta Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: This lusty Cabernet is earthy, jammy and warm on the nose. In the mouth, this is broad and massive, with an undercurrent of firm tannins that provide structure. Deep dark flavors of blackberry, plum and fig finish with strength on a fruit-packed finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Lucien Lardy 2016 Côte du Py  (Morgon)
description: This famed slope in Morgon has produced yet another powerful, structured wine. This one, with dark black fruit, rich tannins and plush texture, is dense and delivers great ripe fruitiness. With its tannins and acidity it will age. Drink from 2019.

title: Maidenstoen 2016 Oliver's Vineyard Riesling (Edna Valley)
description: Springtime fresh on the nose, this bottling by Mike Callahan, who is the assistant winemaker at Chamisal, shows guava, crushed chalk, Key lime skin and ripe melon on the nose. The palate is zippy with penetrating acidity, offering more lime as well as Asian pear and Gravenstein apple flavors.

title: Mueller 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: From one of the warmer mountain ranges in the Napa Valley, this wine exhibits plenty of elegance and classic restraint, though it offers plenty of simultaneous power. Cedar, dried herb, red currant and black pepper make up the range of seasonings, with a touch of crayon wax and bitter leather riding along a substantial grip of tannin. Cellar and enjoy best from 2023–2033.

title: Patz & Hall 2015 Zio Tony Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A salty air of quince and tart lemon give life and freshness to this focused and expansive white, from a site long farmed by the Martinelli family in the heart of the appellation. Green apple and nutmeg add secondary characteristics, as toasted oak appears on the lengthy finish.

title: R&A; Pfaffl 2015 Burggarten Reserve Zweigelt (Niederösterreich)
description: Sumptuous notes of ripe, red cherry almost veer into ripe plum territory and have a spicy, mellow hint of vanilla and cinnamon. The palate replays these flavors, complete with finely woven tannins that seem to boost the aromatic cinnamon notes. A rich wine but without superfluous fat. Lovely, velvety and sensuous in a modern, international style.

title: Robert Mondavi 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is a well-made, powerful wine. Elegant, integrated and effusive in oak, it has pretty apple blossom aromas and boldly layered flavors of green apple, crème brûlée and lemon meringue. The finish is lush in a honeycomb tone. This will do well in the cellar; enjoy 2020–2025.

title: Salomon-Undhof 2016 Von Stein Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: This wine's shy nose gives very little away, apart from a promise of citrus. The palate evokes layers of salty and tangy miso, brightened by mouthwateringly fresh lemon notes that accentuate the saltiness all the way through the finish. This needs time to unfold. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Sixto 2014 Uncovered Chardonnay (Washington)
description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Frenchman Hills (33%), Moxee (28%), Roza Hills (27%) and Evergreen vineyards. The aromas show a lot of subtlety, with notes of candied ginger, lemon curd, spice, peach, cream, toast, wet stone and pineapple, revealing more on each swirl. The palate is rich but refined, showing precision and detail along with a real sense of freshness. The finish impresses. Beautiful stuff.

title: Stadt Krems 2016 Ried Wachtberg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: A creamy whiff of fresh, juicy yellow pear creates a most appetizing nose in this wine. That pure, friendly fruit dominates the palate, illuminating a background of spice and herb notes that recall dried sage and fennel seed. Lemon freshness frames everything and makes for a lovely, full-flavored mouthful.

title: Stift Göttweig 2016 Ried Gottschelle Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: The nose of this wine appears as a creamy cloud of green and yellow pear. The palate continues in a similar vein, its fruity, friendly, appetizing fruit congregated around a central spine of bright lemon freshness. A deeper core of savory yeast notes sleeps just beneath the surface; give it time to wake up. Drink 2020–2028.

title: Tenuta San Guido 2015 Guidalberto Red (Toscana)
description: Redcurrant, blue flower, cedar and a hint of pine forest are just some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant red. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, the bright, savory palate doles out juicy raspberry, red cherry, tobacco and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins while a licorice note graces the close. Enjoy through 2027.

title: Theopolis 2015 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Theodora Lee is making brilliant wines from her estate property in Mendocino County. Great concentration and a monumental structure help this wine stand out, even in a field crowded with those qualities. It tastes a little quiet and tight now, and needs time to mellow so that more complexity and richness comes out. Still, it already shows intriguing layers of black pepper, black fig, blueberry and graphite. Best after 2025.

title: Theopolis 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A stellar example of freshness from a richer region, this bottling offers buoyant and snappy raspberry fruit on the nose alongside dewy forest floor, tangy juniper, soft rose petals and a hint of nutmeg. Fresh and invigorating on the palate, the sip shows tart raspberry, crushed thyme, green peppercorn and tapenade flavors.

title: Vidal-Fleury 2013 Brune et Blonde de Vidal-Fleury  (Côte Rôtie)
description: Hints of coffee, earth, smoke and spice highlight cool, crisp blackberry and cherry flavors in this wine. It's fragrant and fresh, with a vibrant core of acidity and firm tannins that feel taut and thrilling. While beautiful already, its concentrated fruit and mineral complexities should meld from 2021 and continue to improve through 2030.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Coastlands Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From a challenging vintage at times, a tiny amount of this subdued wine was made. The nose offers a sense of peatiness, like a good Scotch. Tart orange and grapefruit define an essential crispness to the fruit, as crushed rock and rose petal play along. The tannins and oak are soft and seamlessly interwoven.
